skillTree.localised_description: Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

skillTree.localised_description: The greatest of the Hippogryphs for the greatest Bretonnian leader since Gilles the Uniter.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: This ancient symbol of Bretonnian supremacy, blessed by the Lady’s kiss, shines with a golden light as if brand new.
"The king without a sword? The land without a king!"

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +8% for Knight units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Led by noble example, peasants fight longer and harder lest their Lord be dishonoured.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
The king has the power to bestow titles on those with honour.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for Knights of the Realm and Questing Knights units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for Knights of the Realm and Questing Knights units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Not since Gilles the Uniter has the Royarch of Bretonnia been so respected.
The barracks are full in anticipation of the king calling the next Errantry War.
As the paragon of chivalry, the king's behaviour reflects on all touched by the Lady.
So great must the king's stature be that when battle is joined it is always with the Lady's blessing.
"You will be the land, and the land will be you. If you fail, the land will perish."

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

skillTree.localised_description: King Louen’s shield has protected him from the first days of his Knighthood; strengthened by enchantment, it will continue to do so.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: Even dull and stupid peasants can aim a bow, but with a little training they can learn to shoot with some success.

skillTree.localised_description: The bloodline of the noblest of all steeds has been preserved; it serves us still.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who serve the Lady purely are rewarded with a portion of her strength when battle is joined.

skillTree.localised_description: Although nothing can replace the thrill of the charge and the righteous clash of steel, seriously heavy artillery generally helps.

skillTree.localised_description: When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...

skillTree.localised_description: There are literally no opponents too great for them to face down. None.

skillTree.localised_description: Thou shalt be everywhere and always the champion of the Right and the Good against Injustice and Evil.

skillTree.localised_description: Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
Those whom the Lady has blessed fight with an unquenchable, almost super-human zeal, for they know that she sees them.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for Lords
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
The king's symbol stands for valour, tactical skills, and the righteous. It is assurance of trust.

effects.description:
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Royal Pegasus Knights and Royal Hippogryph Knights units
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

items.colour_text: The smallest crack of light is reflected into the foe's eyes, so the merest glance of their opponent is so painful they dare not look at them directly.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Chaste, honourable, and untainted by notions of self-aggrandisement, King Louen is the most virtuous of all the Lady's champions.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 when fighting against Undead, Greenskins and all forces of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +12 when fighting against Undead, Greenskins and all forces of Chaos
	(Lord's army)
Passive ability: "The Blessing of the Lady"

backgroundSkills.localised_description:
"When the clarion call is sounded
	 I will ride out and fight in the name of Liege and Lady
	Whilst I draw breath the lands bequeathed
	 unto me will remain untainted by evil
	 Honour is all, Chivalry is all..."

"I set down my lance, symbol of duty
	I spurn those whom I love
	I relinquish all and take up the tools of my quest
	No obstacle will stand before me
	No plea for help shall find me waiting
	No moon will look upon me twice lest I be judged idle
	I give my body, heart and soul to the Lady whom I seek..."

"That which is sacrosanct I shall preserve
	 That which is sublime I will protect
	That which threatens I will destroy
	For my holy wrath will know no bounds..."
